Class TracksMerger

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.videocreator.VideoCreator
it.disi.unitn.videocreator.TracksMerger
public final class TracksMerger extends VideoCreator
A class that helps merge audio and video tracks.

      Parameters:
      builder - The FFMpegBuilderInstance
      outputFile - The path to the output video
      audioInput - The path to the input audio file
      videoInput - The path to the input video file

  • Method Details

    • streamCopy

      public void streamCopy(boolean val)
      This method enables (or disables) the stream-copy option.
      Parameters:
      val - A boolean value used to denote whether the tracks should be stream-copied

    • mergeAudioWithVideo

      public void mergeAudioWithVideo(long time, @NotNull @NotNull TimeUnit timeUnit, @NotNull @NotNull String outdir) throws IOException, InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the correct command to merge the audio and video tracks.
      Parameters:
      time - The maximum amount of time to wait for the video's creation.
      timeUnit - The TimeUnit instance to be used.
      outdir - The given output directory.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given timeout is negative, the TimeUnit instance is null, the video input path or audio input path is null

    • mergeVideos

      public void mergeVideos(long time, @NotNull @NotNull TimeUnit timeUnit, @NotNull @NotNull List<String> inputFiles, @NotNull @NotNull String tempFile, @NotNull @NotNull String outdir) throws IOException, InvalidArgumentException
      This method allows any object of this class to concatenate two or more videos whose path is given as input.
      Parameters:
      time - The maximum amount of time to wait for the video's creation.
      timeUnit - The TimeUnit instance to be used.
      inputFiles - The paths to the input files.
      tempFile - A temporary file used to store the paths of the files to be merged.
      outdir - The chosen working directory.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given timeout is negative or the given TimeUnit instance is null, or if the third or fourth arguments are null or an empty string or contain null or empty strings
